. A precise identification of a ’public'
radio station. Until public radio is
adequately defined, the Corporation is
faced with the task of supporting all
stations in equal fashion. This appears
impractical.
There are, of course, other recommendations
in the Public Radio Study that should, in
time, be implemented.
Now that an exploratory meeting has been
held and the Corporation staff has the view
of radio station managers, establishment of
a set of priorities and a plan of develop¬
ment for educational radio is in order.
Again, National Educational Radio appreciates
the CPB efforts-particularly the beginning
of discussions that will lead to the accomp¬
lishment of the tafcks we face.
Sincerely,
Robert A. Mott
Executive Director, NER
